ai.summary: Barnes Gap is a gentle 5.5 km hike in the United Kingdom, suitable for beginners and families. The route follows well-maintained paths with mostly flat terrain and light elevation gains, offering scenic countryside views. This easy outing typically takes 1.5–2.5 hours depending on pace and stops.
ai.terrain_summary: Terrain consists of grassy paths, compact dirt trails, and occasional rocky or muddy patches. Expect gentle inclines and some uneven sections. The track is generally well-marked, but weather can make surfaces slippery.
ai.safety_notes: Always check the forecast and daylight hours. Wear sturdy footwear and dress for changing UK weather. Carry water and snacks, and let someone know your plan. Bring a map or GPS; mobile reception can be patchy in rural areas. Watch for livestock, cyclists, or other hikers, and stay on marked paths. If fog or rain reduces visibility, turn back.
recommended_gear: Map, GPS device, or fully charged smartphone with offline map
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly April–September) are ideal for Barnes Gap. Winter hikes are possible with proper gear but can be challenging.

seo.title: Barnes Gap Hike - Easy 5.5 km Walk in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Barnes Gap, an easy 5.5 km hike in the United Kingdom. Learn about terrain, safety tips, best seasons, and gear for a comfortable day outdoors.
